intro: Neuracanthus robecchii subsp. robecchii, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing form and produces clusters of small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has hairy, gray-green foliage and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate dry conditions. Neuracanthus robecchii subsp. robecchii is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers.
